abstract: In separate statements, two former directors of Progress Energy said the merged company needed a new chief to restore confidence among investors and regulators.
snippet: In separate statements, two former directors of Progress Energy said the merged company needed a new chief to restore confidence among investors and regulators.
lead_paragraph: Two former Progress Energy directors resigned in protest from the Duke Energy board on Friday and said the company needed a new chief executive to restore confidence among investors and regulators after a boardroom coup this month.

headline.main: Protesting Coup at Duke Energy, 2 Board Members Step Down
